DataElement.preferredName: Patient Objective Symptom Score System Observed Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the determination of an observable phenomena based on fact and not personal feeling or bias of the indications that a person has a condition or disease and based on a number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Objective Symptom Score System Observed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the determination of an observable phenomena based on fact and not personal feeling or bias of the indications that a person has a condition or disease and based on a number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Based on fact or observable phenomena and not on personal feeling or bias.:An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.:a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.:Ascertained or determined through monitoring or observation.

Concepts.definition: Based on fact or observable phenomena and not on personal feeling or bias.
An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.
Ascertained or determined through monitoring or observation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient have a total
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a total score of greater than or equal to 2 based on the protocol specific objective symptom scoring system?
